name: palynological
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
relating to the study of pollen (= the powder, produced by the male part of a flower, that causes the female part of the same type of flower to produce seeds) and spores (= reproductive cells produced by some plants and simple organisms): Pollen records from the mountainous area provide palynological evidence for how the vegetation has shifted over time. Palynological analysis results were disappointing because pollen residues were very sparse.
More examplesFewer examplesHe assigned an age to the sediments based on palynological data. A number of palynological samples were taken from both sites.The changes were examined using palynological data.
